content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE metadata SYSTEM "http://thor-f5.er.usgs.gov/ngtoc/metadata/fgdc-std-001-1998.dtd"> <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>U.S. Geological Survey</origin>         <pubdate>200212</pubdate>         <title>USGS Small-scale Dataset - North American Land Cover Characteristics - 1-Kilometer Resolution 200212 GeoTIFF</title>         <geoform>Map</geoform>         <pubinfo>           <pubplace>Reston, VA</pubplace>           <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>         </pubinfo>         <onlink>http://dds.cr.usgs.gov/pub/data/nationalatlas/landcvi020l_nt00016.tar.gz</onlink>         <lworkcit>           <citeinfo>             <origin>U.S. Geological Survey</origin>             <pubdate>2005</pubdate>             <title>Small-scale Datasets</title>             <onlink>https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/532c5b23e4b0cd7393d07783</onlink>           </citeinfo>         </lworkcit>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract> This map layer is an Arc/INFO grid map of land cover characteristics for  North America, excluding Hawaii, and including the Caribbean and most of  Mexico.  The nominal spatial resolution is 1 km and the map layer is  based on 1-km AVHRR data.  The data were compiled by staff at the National  Center for Earth Resources Observation and Science as part of the Global  Land Cover Characterization Project.  The land cover classes were produced  using 1-km AVHRR data from April 1992 to March 1993.  Documentation and  the original data are available at http://edcsns17.cr.usgs.gov/glcc/.  The data available through the National Atlas of the United States are in  GeoTIFF format.  This is a revised version of the May 2002 map layer, with  a corrected shoreline for Greenland.  </abstract>       <purpose> These data are intended for geographic display and analysis at the  continental level, and for large regional areas.  The data should be  displayed and analyzed at scales appropriate for 1:2,000,000-scale data.  No responsibility is assumed by the U.S. Geological Survey in the use of  these data.  </purpose>       <supplinf> The following table describes the display of land cover characteristics  classes in the TIFF image:    >Value  Class                                  RGB values  >_________________________________________________________  >1      Urban and Built-Up Land                255   0   0  >2 They were converted to  GeoTIFF format for use in the National Atlas Map Maker.  </native>     <crossref>       <citeinfo>         <origin>National Center for EROS, U.S. Geological Survey</origin>         <pubdate>200509</pubdate>         <title>Conterminous United States Land Cover 1992 - 200-Meter Resolution</title>         <geoform>Map</geoform>         <pubinfo>           <pubplace>Reston, VA</pubplace>           <publish>National Atlas of the United States</publish>         </pubinfo>         <othercit> This map layer is a 200-meter resolution image of 1992 land cover for  the conterminous United States, with classification based on a modified  Anderson Land Cover Classification scheme.  See  http://landcover.usgs.gov/classes.asp for more information on the  classification used.  </othercit>         <onlink> http://nationalatlas.gov/atlasftp.html?openChapters=chpbio#chpbio  </onlink>       </citeinfo>     </crossref>   </idinfo>   <dataqual>     <logic>No tests for logical consistency have been performed on this map layer.</logic>     <complete> This map layer contains data for all of North America, except for Hawaii,  the eastern part of Greenland, southern Mexico, and Central America.  </complete>     <lineage>       <srcinfo>         <srccite>           <citeinfo>             <origin>U.S. Geological Survey</origin>             <pubdate>1998</pubdate>             <title> Global Land Cover Characteristics map of seasonal land cover  regions for North America, version 1.2L  </title>             <pubinfo>               <pubplace>Sioux Falls, SD</pubplace>               <publish>National Center for Earth Resources Observation and Science</publish>             </pubinfo>             <othercit> The procedures used in development of this map are described in  Loveland, T.R., Reed, B.C., Brown, J.F., Ohlen, D.O., Zhu, J.,  Yang, L., and Merchant, J.W., 2000.  Development of a Global Land  Cover Characteristics Database and IGBP DISCover from 1-km AVHRR  Data.  International Journal of Remote Sensing, v. 21, no. 6/7,  p. 1,303-1,330.  </othercit>             <onlink>http://edcsns17.cr.usgs.gov/glcc/glcc_version1.html#NorthAmerica</onlink> </srccite>         <typesrc>Online</typesrc>         <srctime>           <timeinfo>             <sngdate>               <caldate>1990</caldate>             </sngdate>           </timeinfo>           <srccurr>Publication date</srccurr>         </srctime>         <srccitea>WVS</srccitea>         <srccontr>Shoreline information.</srccontr>       </srcinfo>       <procstep>         <procdesc> The Land Cover image was downloaded from the EROS site  http://edcsns17.cr.usgs.gov/glcc/glcc_version1.html#NorthAmerica.  A header file was created from the information provided in the North  America Documentation file located at  http://edcsns17.cr.usgs.gov/glcc/nadoc1_2.html  The header file consisted of the following parameters:  >nrows 8996  >ncols 9223  >nbands 1  >nbits 8  >layout BIL  >xdim 1000.0  >ydim 1000.0  >ulxmap -4487000.0  >ulymap 4480000.0  The data were converted from image format to ESRI GRID format using  the command IMAGEGRID.  The file was then reprojected to change the  latitude of projection center from 50 degress to 45 degrees.  A  shoreline mask was created using the file shorelp020l.  It was used to  add land areas not included in the Land Cover map, including some  Aleutian islands, Hawaii, eastern Russia, Iceland, and half of  Greenland.  These land areas were given a code of 255.  The image was  truncated to cover the same area as shorelp020l, and the resulting  file was converted to TIFF format using the RGB colors listed in the  Supplemental_Information section.  </procdesc>         <srcused>Land Cover map</srcused>         <srcused>shorelp020l</srcused>         <procdate>1999</procdate>         <srcprod>LANDCOVER_IMAGE</srcprod>       </procstep>       <procstep>         <procdesc> A GeoTIFF Revision 1.0 header was added and PackBits compression was  applied to the image.  </procdesc>         <srcused>LANDCOVER_IMAGE</srcused>         <procdate>200205</procdate>         <srcprod>LANDCOVER_IMAGE_200205</srcprod>       </procstep>       <procstep>         <procdesc> Image data for Greenland were adjusted and remasked to correct for  geometric distortion in the northwest part of the island between the  Robeson Channel and Cape Morris Jesup, and to improve registration with  a new, corrected coastline derived from World Vector Shoreline (WVS).    A link coverage was created in ArcEdit containing links between the  original Greenland data and the new coastline.  The link coverage was  used in the Arc Adjust command to perform a linear transformation with  nearest neighbor resampling on the original image, stored as an Arc/INFO  grid dataset.  The resulting image is geometrically correct and fits the  WVS coastline.  This correction was applied to data for Greenland only;  the rest of the image was left unchanged.  </procdesc>         <srcused>LANDCOVER_IMAGE_200205</srcused>         <srcused>WVS</srcused>         <procdate>200212</procdate>       </procstep>     </lineage>   </dataqual>   <spdoinfo>     <direct>Raster</direct>     <rastinfo>       <rasttype>Grid Cell</rasttype>       <rowcount>7265</rowcount>
